vWashington House Rabbit Newsv

Volume 6 Issue 4 December 1997


BUNNY BUDDIES NEEDED FOR NEW FOSTER HELP

THE WASHINGTON HOUSE RABBIT SOCIETY IS LOOKING FOR VOLUNTEERS TO BE A BUNNY BUDDY.

What is a Bunny Buddy?
A Bunny Buddy is an experienced rabbit caretaker who is willing to share advice and help an inexperienced rabbit person with fostering a rabbit.

How does it work?
Your phone number will be given to a new rabbit fosterer in your area. When the new fosterer needs advice, she/he can call you for help.

How can I become a Bunny Buddy?
Call the Washington House Rabbit Society's phone number (425) 868-4839, and leave a message. Tell us you'd like to be a Bunny Buddy. Leave your name, phone number, and the city that you live in.

We need as much help as possible. Please call us.

HRS: (425) 868-4839
